introduction.paragraph: This request starts or cancels a database replication operation.

body.paragraph: This request does not have any required headers.
This request does not use query parameters.
The request message body is a JSON document that contains the following objects:

row.entry: Indicates whether to create the target database

Identifies the database to copy revisions from. Can be a string containing a local database name or a remote database URL, or an object whose url property contains the database name or URL. Also an object can contain headers property that contains custom header values such as a cookie.
Identifies the database to copy revisions to. Same format and interpretation as source.

body.paragraph: This response uses only standard HTTP headers.
The response message body is a JSON document that contains the following objects.

row.entry: Indicates whether the replication operation was successful

body.paragraph: The following example replicates the database named beer-db located at sync.couchbasecloud.com to a database named beer-db on the local server.
